intro: Caralluma lateritia, commonly known as the desert fig or stonecress, is a succulent plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Nyctaginaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, ribbed stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in extreme drought conditions, storing water in its thick, fleshy leaves and stems. It produces small, edible berries that are sometimes used in traditional medicine. Caralluma lateritia is a hardy, low-maintenance plant suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
